data.title: Travel Tips Archives
data.text:
Travel Tips

Step back 1.3 billion years in Llano County

You don’t need a time machine to tread Precambrian ground in Llano County. While the area is known for its white-tailed deer population and namesake Llano River, it has another, much older claim to fame: 1.3 billion-year-old rocks. Located center stage on the Llano Uplift, a patch of exposed Precambrian rock, Llano County is a […]

Read More

August 2024 events in Llano County

2:30 p.m. Saturday, Aug. 3 Llano Country Opry presents Marty Haggard LanTex Theater, 113 W. Main St., Llano Marty Haggard takes the stage for “A Tribute to My Dad, Merle Haggard” at the historic LanTex Theater. 9-11 a.m. Saturday, Aug. 24 Cars & Coffee in Llano’s Historic Railyard District Visitors Center & Historic Railyard […]

Read More

Paradise found on Llano River arm of Lake LBJ

Paradise is yours for the taking at this Llano County vacation property with a waterfront view of picturesque Packsaddle Mountain. Located in a quiet waterfront community on the Llano River arm of Lake LBJ in the Highland Lakes, Packsaddle Paradise is the perfect setting for your next getaway. This beautifully updated waterfront vacation home has […]

Read More

Wet your whistle in Llano County

Craft brews, cocktails, spirits, and wine Unique Llano County watering holes feature spirits teasing flavors like pecan, vanilla, and citrus; locally made Texas wines; craftily concocted cocktails; and even an ale named after a Llano landmark: the Red Top Jail. Here’s where to grab a drink in towns across Llano County: LLANO Llano Beer Co. […]

Read More

Relax at River Oaks Retreat on Lake LBJ

If you are wondering why “life is better on the lake,” book a stay at River Oaks Retreat and find out. This five-bedroom, 4½-bath waterfront home on the Colorado arm of Lake LBJ leaves guests smitten with lake life. The perfect spot for a girls’ getaway, a corporate retreat, or even a large family reunion—there’s […]

Read More

July events in Llano County

July 2-7 Kingsland AquaBoom Various locations in Kingsland Kingsland hosts several days of Independence Day activities, including two fireworks shows over Lake LBJ, special dinners, a street dance, land and boat parades, a car show, an arts and crafts show, tournaments, and live music. AquaBoom is free to attend. July 6 Llano Rock’N Riverfest Robinson […]

Read More

June 2024 events in Llano County

Wednesdays in June Boogie at the Bay Quail Point Lodge, 107 Twilight Lane in Horseshoe Bay The 10th annual Boogie at the Bay concert series is Wednesdays in June. Performances are from 6-8 p.m. Admission is free. The lineup is Jody Proctor Band on June 5, Exit 505 Band on June 12, Rochelle & The […]

Read More

Colorado River Retreat LBJ a roomy lake getaway

Colorado River Retreat LBJ is a fantastic property for large lakefront gatherings. The property consists of three distinct spaces with seven bedrooms and six bathrooms. Nestled on the Lake LBJ shoreline, Colorado River Retreat LBJ comfortably accommodates up to 32 guests. The main house, called Lake Daze, has four bedrooms and space for 16 guests. […]

Read More

What’s biting in Llano County?

Drop a fishing line on the lakes and rivers in Llano County and here’s what you’ll reel in. Largemouth bass are the most sought-after fish in Texas. In Llano County, they can be found in all of the Highland Lakes, particularly Buchanan and LBJ. The largemouth bass is easily recognized by the thick, blotchy stripe […]

Read More

Have an unforgettable time at A-Frame Memories

An A-frame no more, A-Frame Memories is a sprawling light and bright waterfront property that comfortably sleeps up to 16. The five-bedroom, three-bath property on Lake LBJ is a warm welcome for those ready for a respite—but don’t get too cozy inside. Just out back, the lake is calling. Designed with families in mind, the […]

Read More

May 2024 events in Llano County

May 4 Llano Fine Art Plein Air Paint Out Castell General Store in Castell Artists meet at 9:30 a.m. for tips and maps before heading out to paint. Judging and awards take place at 4 p.m. May 11 Llano Country Opry LanTex Theater, 113 W. Main St. in Llano Bobby Tomberlin and Tess Frizzell take […]

Read More

Paddle away in Llano County

Kayaking, canoeing, and paddleboarding are fantastic ways to see Llano County from a different perspective. Explore the nooks and crannies of Lake LBJ, Lake Buchanan, and the Llano River and see wildlife and landscapes not often spotted from a road. Paddlers will find no shortage of launch points for non-motorized watercraft in Llano County. Most […]

Read More

Sweet summer fun at Sweet Summer Cove on Lake LBJ

Sleepy oak trees welcome guests to this stunning Lake LBJ property in Kingsland, Texas. Nestled on a private cove in Llano County, Sweet Summer Cove is a pet-friendly, modern farmhouse that comfortably sleeps 12-14. A first-floor master suite offers a king-size bed bedecked in luxury linens and an attached master bath with a soaking tub […]

Read More

April 2024 events in Llano County

April 6 and April 20 9 a.m.-1 p.m. Farmers & Crafters Market Day Llano Courthouse Square, 107 W. Sandstone St. Farmers & Crafters Market on the Courthouse Square occurs on the first and third Saturdays of the month. Find homegrown produce, handmade crafts, baked goods, preserves, local honey, and more. April 8 Total Solar Eclipse Events […]

Read More

Get to know the Llano River

Snaking its way through a county and a town with the same name, the Llano River is a major, navigable waterway that is truly unique. This Central Texas river flows over the Llano Uplift, a geological treasure that dates to the Precambrian period, and is home to the state fish, the Guadalupe bass. Throughout history […]

Read More

March 2024 events and activities

Llano River Chuck Wagon Cook-off Friday-Saturday, March 15-16Badu Park, 300 Legion Drive, LlanoTeams compete in this authentic chuck wagon cooking contest. The meal is sold out, but visitors can still take in the show. Admission is free. Llano Fiddle Fest Saturday-Sunday, March 30-31John L. Kuykendall Events Center, 2200 RR 152 West, LlanoFeaturing the 46th annual […]

Read More

Willkommen auf der Steinhaus Ranch

The German influence is evident at Steinhaus Ranch. This fully restored rustic German farmhouse near the Llano River is as comfortable as it is charming. Conveniently located between Llano and Castell, Steinhaus Ranch is a four-bedroom, two-bath home that comfortably sleeps 11. If you need just a bit more room, the property has a small […]

Read More

Beauty in Bloom in Llano County

Welcome to wildflower season in Llano County! This area of the Texas Hill Country is well-known for the gorgeous and abundant wildflowers that bloom each spring along roadsides and in fields. Believe it or not, native Texas wildflowers love the rugged terrain. The hardy flowers thrive in a variety of soil types, and even the […]

Read More

Llano County is for lovers

Llano County is for lovers: lovers of wildlife and adventure, lovers of rocky, rugged hills, lovers of rivers and lakes. Tote your true love to Llano County, smack dab in the heart of Texas, for a romantic getaway to remember. Snuggle up in a cute cabin hideaway at El Castell on the banks of the […]

Read More

February 2024 Fun in Llano County

February in Llano County includes live music, some cool places to stop and sip awhile, hiking, and, if you’re lucky, a few early-bird bluebonnets. It’s been known to happen! Cody Ray Slaughter at Llano Country Opry With Eli Wilson and George Dickerson 7 p.m. Saturday, Feb. 3 113 W. Main St. in Llano Cody Ray […]

Read More

Sample country life at Cabin at Crooked Creek

Life in the country moves at a slower pace, just like the resident longhorns. Three miles outside of the small Texas Hill Country town of Llano, sits Cabin at Crooked Creek, a charming, tin-roofed getaway near a wet-weather creek — exactly what one would expect of a home on the range. Cabin at Crooked Creek […]

Read More

Downtown Llano, a stroll-able history lesson

Since its beginning as a frontier trading hub in 1856, Llano has maintained a Wild West reputation that started with wagons, horses, and cattle runs and later transitioned, briefly, to that of a mining boomtown before settling into a ranching community. Construction in what is now downtown Llano erupted during the short-lived iron boom. Fortunately, […]

Read More

January 2024 events in Llano County

A new year beckons a new adventure. January 2024 in Llano County begins with a chilly plunge in the Llano River. While winter is not the preferred time for a dip, it is the perfect time for outdoor activity. Fishing and paddling on the Llano River are great year-round activities. Get your toes tapping at […]

Read More

Sleepy Oaks overflows with modern farmhouse charm

Sleepy Oaks Farmhouse is a home away from home you have to see to believe. This large, exquisite, yet homey modern farmhouse-style rental with its own pool is located on a canal off of Lake LBJ in a lovely waterfront neighborhood in Kingsland, Texas. The six-bedroom, four-bathroom home comfortably sleeps 14 and includes a downstairs […]

Read More

Llano County December: twinkling lights, holiday cheer, and merrymaking

December ushers in a healthy dose of holiday cheer in Llano County. Merrymakers will delight in a season featuring the wintry thrills of a snow day and the warm tidings served at a Victorian tea. The Jolly Ol’ Elf himself makes an appearance in Llano during a grand parade and lights display. Get caught up […]

Read More

Turtle Rock, a lakeside cottage on a cove

One weekend is not enough at Turtle Rock. This cottage is nestled on a quiet cove off of Lake LBJ in Kingsland, a community that thrives on waterfront living. The completely renovated 1950s home is decorated with treasures from tropical travels. The front lawn is well kept and welcoming. Mature trees provide ample shade. Turtle […]

Read More

Bring your holidays to the hills

Over the lakes and through the hills to a holiday getaway you’ll go. Whether you are seeking peace on earth or festive merrymaking, it’s yours for the taking in Llano County in the Texas Hill Country. Lakeside homes and cabins offer easy access to the water if fishing tops your wishlist. If golf has gotten […]

Read More

Sip local beer, wine, and spirits in Llano County

At three venues in Llano County, you can sip an adult beverage within a few feet of where the contents were made. The county boasts a winery, a distillery, and a microbrewery, each with an adjacent bar or tasting room. Bottoms up! TOW Take a scenic drive to Tow, on the north shore of Lake […]

Read More

Llano County November: cool air, warm welcomes, and lots to do

The November air is cooler, but a Llano County welcome remains as warm as ever, no matter the weather. This month, shop for gifts and holiday meal fixings, meet your friends or make new ones at a ladies’ night out, feast on a fried fish lunch while supporting a worthy cause, and wrap it all […]

Read More

Fall for a memorable stay at Crestwood Acres

With fall temperatures hitting that “just right” spot, it couldn’t be a better time to escape to Crestwood Acres on beautiful Lake LBJ. This Llano County lodging is too nice a place not to share, and there’s ample room for family and friends. A two-story home, Crestwood Acres sits on an oversized lot featuring a […]

Read More

October in Llano County: food, music, bullriding, and spooky fun

Welcome to an amazing autumn in Llano County. This October, listen to live music, visit a food and drink festival, cheer as riders bounce atop aggressive bulls, enter the dark confines of a haunted house, and watch as jack-o-lanterns float the Llano River. SKYLAND PERFORMANCE 4:30 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 8 1009 Horseshoe Bay Blvd. in […]

Read More

Always haunting season in Llano County

Llano County’s hills, lakes, rivers, and historic architecture attract visitors from far and wide. It appears to have drawn a few apparitions, too. Over the years, people have experienced strange sights and sounds in and around the county. Here are a few. Llano Red Top Jail 400 Oatman in Llano By appointment only; call 325-247-5354 […]

Read More

Prepare to be spoiled at Turner Lakehouse

If “spoil myself” sits near the top of your to-do list, read on and then book a stay at Turner Lakehouse on Lake LBJ. A perfect vacation home, Turner Lakehouse sits next to the water and provides great views all around with ample room for you and as many as 13 other happy campers. Stroll […]

Read More

Fall for Llano County this September

A fun September in Llano County features music, food, art, and the area’s ever-present natural beauty and hospitality. SIP & STROLL ART SHOW AND SALE 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 2 124 Sunrise Drive in Sunrise Beach Village This little town on the western shore of Lake LBJ comes alive with wine tastings, art […]

Read More

Llano County’s museums are windows to its history

To get a closer look at the rich and vibrant history of Llano County, and learn more about what’s made the area the special place it is, visit its artifact-filled museums. Don’t just rush through them; take time to study the exhibits, photos, art, and documents. It could be the best few hours you’ve spent. […]

Read More

Get away to Bonnie Brae on Lake LBJ

With its glistening lakes and flowing rivers, Llano County is made for spending time on, in, or near the water. That makes Bonnie Brae the ultimate summer getaway. It’s got 67 feet of waterfront on Lake LBJ with great views and easy access. This contemporary home sits on a rise above the lake with guests […]

Read More

Plan a girls’ night out in August in Llano County

There’s always lots to see and do in Llano County, so don’t let the August heat keep you away. This month, shop at a farmers’ market and a garage sale, check out vintage autos, listen to live country music, and cool off in one of Llano County’s lakes and rivers. OLDIES BUT GOODIES CAR SHOW […]

Read More

Enjoy the outdoors at a Llano County park

Llano County’s rivers, lakes, hills, granite formations, and generally good weather make it a destination for outdoor recreation and relaxation. The following five parks give visitors and locals a full range of open-air pursuits, from birding to fishing and picnicking to barbecuing. BUCHANAN DAM Black Rock Park, 3400 Texas 261, Buchanan Dam — This Lower […]

Read More

A crowd-pleasing Horseshoe Bay getaway on Pecan Creek

If you’re booking a weekend escape for a large group, 624 Pecan Creek is a great place to go. It’s located in a quiet section of Horseshoe Bay, one of the most attractive communities in the Highland Lakes. The home features a main house and a guest house and sits on a large creekside lot […]

Read More

Llano County July: parades, races, live music, fireworks

A big Independence Day festival, personal watercraft races on the Llano River, lots of live music, courthouse square events that always draw crowds, and fireworks. July is the month to visit Llano County. KINGSLAND AQUABOOM Saturday-Tuesday, July 1-4 Various locations in Kingsland This mega-celebration packs in the fun with parades, contests of all kinds, food, […]

Read More

Relax by Lake LBJ at River House

When you’re at River House, overlooking a calm stretch of Lake LBJ, you might find it hard to say inside. This place takes full advantage of its waterfront location with inviting outdoor spaces that complement the lovely, tranquil surroundings. A spacious yard features mature trees that help shade the sun, a playscape for the kiddos, […]

Read More

Kingsland AquaBoom: Big celebration in a small town

There are Independence Day celebrations and then there is Kingsland’s AquaBoom, a mega-fete that goes on for days and features more than 20 events. AquaBoom evolved from a community fireworks display held in 1969, a few months after the completed RM 2900 bridge over the Llano River made the lakeside community more accessible to both […]

Read More

Llano Fine Art Guild and Gallery lookin’ good at 60

The Llano Fine Art Guild and Gallery, a major player in Llano County’s artistic community, turned 60 on May 8. What began as a painting club in 1963 has evolved into a premier showcase for local and nationally known artists. Recent renovations have turned the gallery into a comfortable, smartly designed show space that could […]

Read More

Make Llano County your summer place in June

Summer 2023 is here and Llano County rings in the month of June with festivals, kayak lessons, a downtown marketplace, and lots of live music. LLANO HERITAGE DAY FESTIVAL 9 a.m.-7 p.m. Saturday, June 3 Courthouse Square in Llano Celebrate Llano’s colorful history with storytellers, historical re-enactors, and German and Native American dancers. […]

Read More

Vacation on the next level at this Inks Lake retreat

Book a stay at 612 N. Rockwood and prepare to take your Highland Lakes vacation to the next level. This rustic modern home, situated on a no-wake cove of Inks Lake in Llano County, takes full advantage of its waterfront location with Instagrammable vistas from almost any point, indoors or out. Just outside the home, […]

Read More

Llano County in May: Live music, live theater, and a festival for fried testicles

Welcome to the last full month of spring in Llano County. In May, watch live theater, tap your toes to Western swing, celebrate the Texas Parks and Wildlife Department’s centennial with s’mores, and get your fill of food and music at a festival with a memorable name. For more information on events and attractions in […]

Read More

Lake Buchanan Lodge: Rustic without roughing it

A stay at Lake Buchanan Lodge in Llano County gives you an unbeatable combination of rustic ambiance with modern conveniences, a prime Texas Hill Country location, and ample space for you and your fellow vacationers. Movie buffs will recognize this splendid home as a shooting location for the 2017 film “Cabin Crew.” Walk past the […]

Read More

Have a ball at Castell Testicle Festival

In Castell, the month of May brings the biggest party of the year: The annual Testicle Festival. On May 20, hundreds of visitors and Llano County locals will descend on the small riverside Castell community for a full day of music, drinks, fun, and food. What started as a small get-together based on the Western […]

Read More

April in Llano County: Mudbugs, music, bike races, and wildflowers all around

April is a colorful month in Llano County as wildflowers dominate the landscape in every direction and springtime temperatures make a welcome return. This month, take your pick of food festivals, a gravel road bicycle race, lots of live music, and an annual native plant and tree sale. It’s a banner wildflower season in 2023, […]

Read More

Wildflower season in full bloom in Llano County

Predictions of an extra bountiful bluebonnet season in Central Texas, including Llano County, are coming true. In early March, the Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Center in Austin announced that a dry summer and a wet fall would result in a robust wildflower season, which burst open in splendid blue and white in mid-March. The summer […]

Read More

Enchanted Rock celebrates 45 years as state park

Enchanted Rock State Natural Area is one attraction that lives up to its name and then some. As you approach from RR 965, this giant outcropping of granite dominates the landscape, exuding mystery, wonder, and enchantment. Stay awhile and watch the rock’s colors change as the day progresses. Remain after dark to admire the silhouette […]

Read More

Llano County warms up with March events

March ushers in a change of seasons in Llano County, and that means more events and outdoor activities. March 2023 offers plenty to do here, indoors or out. Learn about earth art, catch a local theater production, check out a fiddler competition, say “Happy Birthday” to a beloved state park, savor the sights and smells […]

Read More

History, seclusion, stunning views at Pecan Creek Ranch in Llano County

Pecan Creek Ranch in Llano County offers an escape from the ordinary with history, seclusion, and natural beauty. The land here, north of Llano and off of Texas 16, has been in the same family for generations. You will feel worlds away amid 1,900 acres of historic ranchland. Take a hike to explore your surroundings, […]

Read More

February 2023: Art shows, community garage sale, and country music

It’s February, that short month that is best known for its day commemorating love. Bring your loved one to Llano County in February to hunt for hidden treasures at a community garage sale, enjoy an evening of barbecue and music, listen to award-winning classic country, and admire the artwork at a new show. LLANO PICKERS […]

Read More

Say your vows in a Llano County wedding

Plan the perfect wedding in a location worthy of the event itself. With its majestic blend of lakes, hills, rivers, and small-town vibes, Llano County offers a wide range of amazing venue choices for every budget. Visit Llano County to plan a wedding in a historic building, an outdoor garden, or on the shores of […]

Read More

Stay at the Beach in Llano County

If you’ve ever planned a large group outing, you know the hardest part: finding accommodations that suit everyone. Beach House 1 in Llano County is the easy answer for even the most diverse of interests. This sprawling property on the Llano River arm of Lake LBJ can house up to 24 people with ease and […]

Read More

Cool weather hiking

Llano County lies within the most beautiful swathe of country that Texas has to offer, and the best way to see it is on the trail. Hill Country hiking is at its best in the cooler months of the year, so late fall through early spring is ripe with opportunity for adventure. As the temperature […]

Read More

Enjoy historic stay at Steinhaus Ranch

A stay at Steinhaus Ranch offers seclusion, space, scenery, and history on a 170-acre slice of scenic Llano County. The two-story Steinhaus, which is German for stone house, was constructed in 1897. The owners have added modern touches, such as central heat and air and an all-electric kitchen, without compromising the home’s historic and architectural […]

Read More

Start the new year in Llano County

Enjoy the transition from a bustling December to a slower-paced January on a visit to Llano County. Don’t worry: There’s still plenty of fun to be had. You can kick off 2023 by jumping into the Llano River with several other brave souls or tap your toes to 1950s rockabilly music at the historic LanTex […]

Read More

December 2022 events in Llano County

It’s already December, your last shot at making good on those 2022 resolutions. And, if you resolved to sneak away to the Texas Hill Country, Llano County awaits with holiday and non-holiday happenings to help you end the year on a high note. Get in last-minute shopping, feast your eyes on stunning Christmas lights displays, […]

Read More

There’s no place like Llano County for the holidays

Make a holiday visit to Llano County, where a chill in the air meets small-town warmth and thousands of tiny lights twinkle against a dark winter sky. Each December, Llano County sings with holiday happenings. Marvel at beautifully lit Christmas displays, go back in time to Charles Dickens’ London, tour classic homes and businesses, or […]

Read More

Room to roam at Hill Country Hopaway

Drive past the rabbit-adorned wagon at the ranch gate of Hill Country Hopaway and prepare for a memorable and relaxing retreat at this comfy vacation home in Llano County. The ranch house sits on 4 acres of beautiful Texas Hill Country punctuated by granite outcroppings, a geological trademark of Llano County. The front porch was […]

Read More

A November to remember in Llano County

November is a busy month in Llano County, with everyone from deer hunters to Christmas revelers filling the towns and countryside. Hunters get a welcome party in early November. Later in the month, the twinkling lights of Christmas illuminate the evenings and fill residents and visitors alike with holiday spirit. Here’s a look at just […]

Read More

Best of both worlds at Cabin at Crooked Creek

If you’re looking for seclusion without being too remote, Cabin at Crooked Creek could be the answer to that elusive quest. This rustic cabin provides the experience of being away from it all without being that far away. To best appreciate the Texas Hill Country vistas here, slide into a chair on one of two […]

Read More

Art at the heart of Llano County

Spend time in Llano County and you’ll soon fall in love with the hills, lakes, scenic drives, vintage architecture, authentic local cuisine, and abundant wildlife. These things not only sate the senses, they also fuel the creative juices, which is why an active and vibrant art scene thrives here. On a typical weekend, you could […]

Read More

OCTOBER EVENTS IN LLANO COUNTY

The highlight of October in Llano is always the annual Llano River Pumpkin float, but plenty more to do is on this month’s calendar. It’s a beautiful time of the year to be outside in the Texas Hill Country. 10-11 a.m. Sundays, Oct. 9, 16, 23, 30 SUNRISE GOSPEL AT WAKEPOINT LBJ 14757 RR 1431 […]

Read More

Lone Star Oasis a lakeside escape

If you’re looking for a retreat from the ordinary, an escape from everyday chaos, or just a little change in latitude/attitude, you’ll find it at Lone Star Oasis on Lake Buchanan. Just enter the living room with its vaulted ceiling, gaze out through the floor-to-ceiling windows at the lake, and let the chill-out vibes take […]

Read More

Live music, movies, more in September in Llano County

CAR SHOW AND SOCIAL CLUB 6:30-8:30 p.m. Fridays Llano Courthouse Square in Llano A gathering of those who love classic cars, trucks, and motorcycles to socialize and admire. TOP MOVIES AT THE LANTEX THEATER LanTex Theater 113 W. Main St. in Llano 7:30 p.m. Sept. 2-3 — “Top Gun: Maverick” Sept. 16-17 — “Where the […]

Read More

La buena vida at La Casa Roja

When you spend a few days at La Casa Roja, you’re not just visiting Llano County, you’re getting an immersive experience in the legendary Texas Hill Country. A plethora of attractions and other quaint communities are just minutes away from this spacious Llano County lodging and its updated accommodations complete with gorgeous views of the […]

Read More

Distilling Hill Country Spirits in Llano

The spirit of the Hill Country is alive and well in Llano County, and you can actually taste it at Llano Craft Distillery. Award-winning vodka is distilled right on the Llano town square and cut with pure water from the Llano River itself. While Llano Craft Distillery is relatively young, coming into being in the […]

Read More

Welcome to Llano County

Visit Llano County for a fabulous vacation in the breathtaking hills of the Texas Hill Country. You’ll find rivers, parks, attractions, restaurants, and shopping galore. For those who love to explore the outdoors, the county has plenty of places to swim, boat, and fish on lakes Buchanan or LBJ as well as the Llano River. […]

Read More

Castell extends a warm welcome to visitors

disse id libero lectus. Donec sagittis ut nisl vitae mattis. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia curae;
